revised_title: Structural Features of T-Cell Recognition and Applications to Vaccine Design
tldr: The article discusses the structural features of T-cell recognition and their applications to vaccine design. It highlights the importance of antigen processing, major histocompatibility complex (MHC) molecules, and intrinsic factors in determining immunodominance. The authors also explore the role of amphipathic helices in immunodominant sites and their potential use in predicting antigenic sites for vaccine development.
